definition: to act as regent
to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)
political/politics/government
regent

sentences.english: Well, all the same stuff as in the Apple store half a mile away on Regent Street.
sentences.chinese: 半公里外的攝政街蘋果旗艦店也有同樣的商品。

sentences.english: So, his planned Regent's palacewas shelved.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他計劃的攝政王府被擱置。

sentences.english: Rows of flags along Regent Street, London, in preparation for the royal wedding. Photograph: Carl Court/PA
sentences.chinese: 沿着倫敦攝政街一排排的旗幟，在爲皇室婚禮做準備。

sentences.english: The idea is that Mr Chang will act as a kind of regent.
sentences.chinese: 張成澤將扮演攝政王的角色，支持金正雲。

sentences.english: Tesla grabbed the false Regent by the cowl and dragged him to his knees.
sentences.chinese: 泰斯拉一把抓住假攝政王的肉甲，把他拖到地上跪下。

sentences.english: The house itself was full of Regency furniture.
sentences.chinese: 這所住宅到處陳列着攝政時期的傢俱。

sentences.english: " one of the Invid cut him off. "The Regent killed?
sentences.chinese: 其中一個因維人打斷了他，“攝政王被殺了？

sentences.english: The lodgings selected faced the Regent Gardens.
sentences.chinese: 這所選定的公寓面對着攝政公園。

sentences.english: The regent carried out an advanced system in his country.
sentences.chinese: 攝政者在他的國家推行了一套先進的制度。

sentences.english: For your next visit to Kuwait, look no further than The Regency Kuwait.
sentences.chinese: 你下次訪問科威特，看看沒有進一步的比科威特攝政。

sentences.english: When the king left on the Second Crusade he appointed Suger regent and left him in charge of the government.
sentences.chinese: 國王在第二次東征前任命蘇傑攝政和負責政府。

definition: imperial edict
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
posthumous edict (of former emperor)
vassal state
White Lotus society
Guangxu Emperor
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
lit. to govern from behind the curtain/to rule in place of the emperor (idiom)
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
to die in battle (idiom)
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
privy council
